channel.title: Can't keep server running on Linux VPS
channel.description:
Ok, so I just got an ubuntu VPS. This is my first time every using linux. I finally got a private server running but the way I had to do it was a lot of trouble.
I have to use No-IP using wine. I could not get it running through terminal. It kept telling me that no network device could be found or something. So I got it running through Wine and I finally got the run.sh working. I did most of this through TightVNC. Since I only have 1gb of RAM, I can't run the server while TightVNC is running or it gives me errors about not having enough memory. I can run the server from putty, but when I close it, the server closes. Is there any way I can run the server and no-ip without having to leave putty up?
I have tried nohup, and it worked for a couple of minutes until the server closed suddenly.

item.title: Can't keep server running on Linux VPS
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

If you are using wine at all you are doing it wrong. Java is written for Linux, and if it’s a VPS, it should have a static IP right? So you shouldn’t even need to use no-ip, even though it is also fully supported under Linux.

edit:
Yes, you should be using putty or similar to ssh into your server, if you want to run a command and not have it exit when you do, you can use screen, or more simply, nohup:

‘nohup /path/to/command_you_want_to_run.sh &’

Then any output will go to ‘nohup.out’. The nohup is short for no-hangup which means it won’t exit when you do, and the & means run in the background. A simple google search would have told you all of this.
